courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Basic Cardiology
courses.description: The course will provide comprehensive coverage in basic anatomy, physiology, autonomic system, ECG interpretation, circulation control, molecular biology, endothelial function, hypertension, pregnancy, basic biostatistics and medical ethics.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire essential knowledge of basic anatomy, physiology, autonomic system, ECG interpretation, circulation control, molecular biology, endothelial function, hypertension, pregnancy, basic biostatistics and medical ethics through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with her/his supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervisor to write up a these and monitors the studetns' academic progess

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Clinical Cardiology I
courses.description: This part will cover heart failure, valvular heart disease, acute coronary disease and cardiomyopathy.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire essential and up-to-date knowledge of heart failure, valvular heart disease, acute coronary disease and cardiomyopathy through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Clinical Cardiology II
courses.description: This part will focus on cardiac arrhythmia, adult congenital heart disease, pulmonary hypertension, risk stratification for non-cardiac surgery and management of cardiac emergency.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire essential and up-to-date knowledge of cardiac arrhythmia, adult congenital heart disease, pulmonary hypertension, risk stratification for non-cardiac surgery and management of cardiac emergency through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Clinical Seminar I
courses.description: The seminar will be conducted in the form of problem-solving or case-based tutorial session. It will present cases employing an integrated cardiac approach which involves the use of various modalities of investigation and treatment.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire knowledge of problem-solving or case-based tutorial session. It will present cases employing an integrated cardiac approach which involves the use of various modalities of investigation and treatment through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Clinical Seminar II
courses.description: This seminar will present the latest advances in the diagnosis and management of cardiovascular diseases. It will cover a broad spectrum of topics encompassing cardiomyopathies, cardiac arrhythmia and device therapy, heart failure, coronary artery disease, interventional cardiology, echocardiography and cardiac imaging, hypertension, metabolic syndrome, cardiac and stroke rehabilitation, clinical trials as well as pharmacotherapy for various cardiac diseases.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire essential and up-to-date knowledge of the latest advances in the diagnosis and management of cardiovascular diseases. It will cover a broad spectrum of topics encompassing cardiomyopathies, cardiac arrhythmia and device therapy, heart failure, coronary artery disease, interventional cardiology, echocardiography and cardiac imaging, hypertension, metabolic syndrome, cardiac and stroke rehabilitation, clinical trials as well as pharmacotherapy for various cardiac diseases through lectures, interactive case presentation and discussion.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Cardiac Procedures
courses.description: It will be illustrated by videos and introduces basic knowledge of various cardiac investigations and procedures, including basic techniques and precautions.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire basic knowledge of various cardiac investigations and procedures, including basic techniques and precautions through lectures and videos illustration.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Clinical Attachment
courses.description: The one-week clinical attachment involves spending 5.5 days in rotation at the cardiac unit of the Prince of Wales Hospital. Students will acquire basic knowledge of the daily running and care of patients undergoing diagnostic and therapeutics cardiac procedures.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to acquire basic knowledge of the daily running and care of patients undergoing diagnostic and therapeutics cardiac procedures through 5.5 days in rotation at the cardiac unit of Prince of Wales Hospital.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Dissertation
courses.description: A 5,000-word dissertation in the form of topical review is required for graduation.
courses.learning_outcomes: Under guidance of his/her supervisor, students are required to complete a dissertation in the form of topical review of about 5,000 words. Through the dissertation preparation, students both learn and demonstrate the ability to conduct independent, original, and significant research.
courses.course_syllabus: In this course, a student is required to meet with his/her supervisor regularly who provides necessary guidance and supervision to write up a thesis and monitors the students' academic progress.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Please refer to the supervisor information
courses.required_readings: Please refer to the supervisor information

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Advanced Clinical Seminar
courses.description: This seminar will include a series of comprehensive seminars focusing on latest advances in the diagnosis and management of cardiovascular diseases to internal and local healthcare professionals.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Only for students of Master of Science in Cardiology
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of this module, student will have:
1. Demonstrated an in-depth knowledge and understanding of the scientific foundation of cardiology practice.
2. Demonstrated the ability to understand the medications and how these can affect an individualâ€™s function
3. Demonstrated the ability to access a range of information sources necessary to manage cardiology patients effectively

courses.subject: CVSM
courses.title: Advanced Clinical Cardiac Specialty Attachment
courses.description: The Advanced Clinical Cardiac Specialty Attachment involves spending a few days in rotation to different cardiac units at different times, observing how senior cardiologists looking after out-patient cardiac patients.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Only for students of Master of Science in Cardiology
courses.learning_outcomes:
On successful completion of this module, student will have:
1. Familiarized daily running and care of patients undergoing diagnostic and therapeutics cardiac procedures
2. Demonstrated their ability to examine, undertake risk assessment and investigate patients presenting with various cardiac diseases.
3. Demonstrated their ability to manage patients on discharge from acute services who have undergone a cardiac event or cardiac procedure and provide secondary prevention management.
